alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 1:25PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz affecting Mineral County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. Moderate flooding downstream from Weber Dam is ongoing. Some low lying and agricultural areas below Weber are flooded, including some rural access roads. Severe bank erosion is ongoing, with a large amount of debris in the river channel, so use extreme caution along the riverbanks. For the Mainstem Walker River...including PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is ongoing. * WHERE...Walker River near PT Site below Weber Reservoir near Schurz. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Moderate flooding below Weber Reservoir impacting agricultural land and access roads. River Bank instability may cause additional impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:10 PM PDT Monday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the past 24 hours was 19.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood stage is 17.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday.
